title: Education
text: During my time at UCSB, there were certain classes which I felt were extremely impactful, as they taught me important skills and knowledge, and influenced my career path. Some of these classes, as well as the way in which they influenced me, are listed below. I have also included some projects, created during my undergraduate education, which I am especially proud of.

title: Education
text:
Key Courses
Agroecology, taught by Liz Carlisle
Soils of California, taught by Iriz Holzer
Statistics for Environmental Studies, by An Bui
Environmental Economics, by Robert Heilmayr

title: About me
text:
Hi! My name is Katie, and I am a recent graduate from the University of California, Santa Barbara. I studied environmental science, with an emphasis in physical geography, and was fortunate to take classes that broadened my interests, technical skills, and worldview. It was at UCSB that I discovered a passion for regenerative agriculture, through classes and fieldwork, and began working at a small off-campus farm. In the next few years, I aim to put my knowledge and experience to use by working on other farms that are guided by regenerative principles, and by getting more involved in the sustainable food sector. I aim to continue learning and growing in this field, and working towards a society in which our food system is seen as a solution to the climate crisis, rather than a problem.
I am also interested in climbing, mountain biking, traveling, writing, and creating artwork. My passion for the environment and the outdoors guides all of these interests, and this is clear from the topics I write about and the scenes I portray in my paintings. I have created this webpage not just to showcase my educational accomplishments, but also to share a bit about this more personal side of myself.





Graduation picture with friends (I am in the center).





Rock climbing in Santa Barbara, California.





Rock climbing in Bishop, California.





Simply enjoying the great outdoors.

title: Artwork
text:
About my art
This page showcases my artwork, beginning with a piece from 2020, when I was in high school, and ending with a piece from March 2024. My art tends to use vibrant colors, and is primarily made with acrylic paints. I am inspired by nature and the outdoors; by plants and animals, fungi, clouds, the way the sun creates patterns in the sky at different times of day. I am also inspired by the human body and form; the beauty of the way bodies roll and ripple, and change over time. I use art as a way to reflect and work through internalized societal notions of the female body as a sexual object, and as such, my paintings are a form of healing. I hope you enjoy, and maybe even find them healing as well.


Art for purchase
Please contact me via my email (kcheslick48@gmail.com) if you are interested in purchasing a piece from here, seeing more art, or having a custom painting made.
